item.title: Dr Michael Heath: Families feared they cremated the wrong person
item.description: Families say Dr Michael Heath made multiple errors investigating the deaths of their loved ones.

item.title: Marcus Rashford defends charity deals over profit claims
item.description: The England striker asks why footballers "can't just do the right thing" for charity.

item.title: Seaside poor health overlooked, warns Whitty
item.description: Bad housing and deprivation are a toxic mix for health, says England's chief medical officer.

item.title: England heatwave: Giant hail in Leicestershire damages cars
item.description: Golf ball-sized hail comes "thundering down" as the extreme heat warning for England continues.

item.title: Teenager found dead in Knottingley canal in hot weather
item.description: The boy's death is the fourth nvolving water in Yorkshire over the past few days.

item.title: Hospital cleaner: 'Nobody says thank you'
item.description: Ernesta has been campaigning for better pay and conditions for cleaners during the pandemic.

item.title: Girl killed in Wiltshire crash 'full of life and laughter'
item.description: Eloise Jackson, 7, was struck by a lorry while riding her bicycle in Collingbourne Ducis, Wiltshire.

item.title: Latitude 2021: What being a Covid test event means for the festival
item.description: The festival in Suffolk will be the first major event following the lifting of most restrictions.

item.title: E-scooter crash leaves girl, 3, seriously injured
item.description: A three-year-old is left with "life-changing" injuries from a collision with an e-scooter.

item.title: Vue cinema chain fined £750,000 over seat crush death
item.description: Ateeq Rafiq died after getting his head stuck under a motorised footrest while searching for keys.

item.title: Diamonds swapped for pebbles in London gem heist
item.description: Gems worth £4.2m were allegedly swapped for pebbles at a Mayfair jewellers, a court hears.

item.title: Student murdered in watch robbery attempt near Harrods, court hears
item.description: The student was stabbed in the chest and collapsed and died near the Harrods Christmas tree.

item.title: Covid: Sutton Coldfield restaurant 'lost £100k' due to isolating staff
item.description: Owner Claire Brough said it should have been the "perfect time" for them when Covid rules relaxed.

item.title: Covid: What easing restrictions mean to people in a Witham estate
item.description: What does the lifting of restrictions in England mean to those living in a housing estate?

item.title: Bridlington 'cautiously' welcomes lockdown lifting
item.description: People visiting and working in Bridlington give their views on the lifting of England's lockdown restrictions.

item.title: Covid rules from 19 July: What has changed?
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules have taken effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Covid: Royal Blackburn Hospital facing huge pressures
item.description: Royal Blackburn Hospital staff say they are feeling the pressure due to a rise in Covid cases.

item.title: Thunderstorms hit after hot spell
item.description: The Met Office has issued an amber warning for thunderstorms.

item.title: Manchester canals: Meet the paddle boarders cleaning up the towpaths
item.description: Volunteers have been using their spare time to go litter picking along Manchester's canal tow paths.

item.title: Derbyshire lorry driver builds kestrel nest boxes in spare time
item.description: Nature-loving lorry driver builds nest boxes for kestrels in his spare time.

item.title: England nightclubs reopen: Cheers and celebrations as clubbers return for first night out
item.description: For some revellers in Leeds, this was the first time they'd ever been to a nightclub.

item.title: Premier League player held over child sex allegations
item.description: The Premier League player has since been bailed and suspended by his club while inquiries continue.

item.title: Joe Anderson: Ex-mayor investigated for intimidating chief exec
item.description: Joe Anderson is being investigated for alleged witness intimidation of a council chief, a court hears.

item.title: River Weaver: Body found in search for 16-year-old boy
item.description: Emergency services had been scouring the River Weaver near Frodsham in Cheshire since Monday.

item.title: Oldham murder: Man jailed for killing ex-wife over house sale
item.description: Susan Booth was attacked with an axe after her husband was told the family home would be sold.

item.title: Manchester Arena Inquiry: Police deny stopping doctor in aftermath
item.description: PC Troy Tyldesley and PC James Dalton were on duty at the scene of the 2017 Manchester attack.

item.title: Lord Ahmed: Child sex abuse trial set for November
item.description: Lord Ahmed of Rotherham denies charges of sexually abusing a boy and a girl in the early 1970s.

item.title: Man stuck in M4 jam plays football on carriageway
item.description: There was a three-hour tailback on the M4 in Wiltshire after a lorry caught fire.

item.title: 'Covid passports': Nightclub owners criticise double-jab plans
item.description: Owners and promoters accuse the government of using their industry as "a political football".

item.title: Stockport couple stole £580k in solicitor timeshare scam
item.description: Caroline Preston and Sean Thompson are jailed for conning vulnerable and elderly people.

item.title: Eid Al-Adha 2021: Outdoor prayers return in Birmingham
item.description: Organisers decide not to hold a large gathering in Small Heath Park due to rising rates of Covid-19.

item.title: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: How many cases in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Florida Cup: Arsenal withdraw due to 'small number' testing positive for Covid-19
item.description: Arsenal withdraw from the Florida Cup and cancel their pre-season trip to the US after a "small number" of their touring party test positive for Covid-19.

item.title: England v Pakistan: Hosts win thrilling T20 series decider at Old Trafford
item.description: England overcome an almighty wobble to defeat Pakistan in a pulsating final Twenty20 at Old Trafford and win the series 2-1.

item.title: The Hundred: Cricket set for new fast-paced, opinion-splitting tournament
item.description: Everything you need to know about The Hundred - cricket's new fast-paced tournament - which begins on Wednesday, live on BBC Two.

item.title: Everton sign Andros Townsend and Asmir Begovic
item.description: Everton sign former England winger Andros Townsend and experienced goalkeeper Asmir Begovic.
